result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua David Micke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Court calls 15CF88, 15CF80, 14CM220, 15CF144 & 15CF162 @ 2:00 pm. Defendant Joshua David Micke in court, in custody with attorney Gavin Grubofski.   Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State has copy of revocation summary and no corrections. Atty Grubofski has copy of revocation summary and no corrections.  Defendant Joshua David Micke in court with attorney Gavin Grubofski.  State gives sentencing recommendation and would like a sentence run concurrent 14cm220 Ct 1 9 months jail, 140 days credit, ct 3 9 months jail, 140 days, 15cF162 6 years , 3 yrs in, 3 yrs ex 150 days credit, ct 3 169 days credit, ct 3 9 months jail, 15CF80, ct 1 9 months jail, 154 days credit, ct 4 9 months jail, 154 days, ct 5 9 months jail, 174 days, 15CF144, ct 1 9 months jail, 179 days, ct 2 6 yrs prison, 3 yrs initial, 3 yrs e.s.  179 days, 15CF88 6 yrs prison, 3 yrs initial, 3 yrs e.s.  156 days.  All sentence run concurrent. Def. is eligible for Challenge and Substance Programs.  Atty Grubofski gives statement. 15CF144 30 days credit on each ct, 10 days on holds, so has 180 days, 14CM220 ct 1 170 days ct 3 150 days, 15CF162 179 days credit both ct's.  State agrees with 14CM220 would agree to 170 days. Atty Grubofski would like to reserve right to be heard on credit needs to more work on figuring. Def. makes statement. State can't come up with agree on revocation materials and need to clarify with agent on credit.  Hold on sentence credit 15CF162.  Atty Grubofski stands by number he gave on credit.  State has problem giving more credit. Court orders on 
14CM220 Ct 1 9 months jail,  170 days credit
Ct 3 9 months jail, days credit, 150 days credit, Convert court obligations to civil judgment

15CF80 Ct 1  9 months jail, 154 days credit, 
Ct 4 9 months jail, 145 days credit
Ct 5 9 months jail, 174 days credit. Convert court obligation to civil judgment. 

15CF88 Ct 1 6 years prison, 3 years initial confinement, 3 years extended supervision, 156 days credit, Def. is eligible for Challenge and Substanace Abuse program. Convert costs to civil judgment. 

15CF144 Ct 1 9  months jail, 180 days credit
Ct 2 6 years prison, 3 years initial confinement, 3 years extended supervision, 180 days credit. Def. is eligible for Challenge and Substanace Abuse program. Converted court obligations to civil judgment. 

15CF162 Ct 1 6 years prison, 3 years initial confinement, 3 years extended supervision, 179 days credit, Def. is eligible for Challenge and Substanace Abuse program. 
Ct 3 9 months jail, 179 days credit, Court costs converted to civil judgment
Def. advised of postconviction rights. State has complied with victim rights.  All sentence are concurrent to each other and with any other sentence currently serving.
Ad Prosequendum & Order to Institution - see 15CF80

Defendant Joshua David Micke in court with attorney Paul M Goetz.  Defendant Joshua David Micke in custody.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called 15CF80, 15CF88, 15CF144, 15CF162, 14CM220 and 15CM143  Called at 9:21 pm.  15CF88 Ct 4, def entered a plea, statement by Atty Bayne-Allison.  State will move to dismiss ct 4.  No objection by Atty Goetz.  Court will dismiss ct 4 in 15CF88.  PSI correction 15CF162 def entered plea to Ct 1 & 3  Jeff Johnson, alternative PSI author duly sworn on oath, testifies.   Atty Bayne-Allison checks on victim rights notification.  Recess 9:48 am  Reconvene 9:54 am  Victim rights have been complied with.  State presents sentencing arguments.  State requesting 15CF88 prison 4 yrs, 2 initial & 2 yr. extended  15CF144 prison, initial conf and extended.  15CF162 withhold sentence, 3 yrs probation consecutive   Balance of charges, state request court to follow the PSI report.  Atty Goetz presents sentencing arguments.  Requesting court to follow the recommendations in alternative PSI report.  Statement by def.  Sentencing remarks by court.  15CF80 Ct 1 - Sentence withheld, 1 yr probation.  10 days jail  court cost.  DNA surcharge$200. Cr 4 days if revoked.  Huber privileges.  Ct4 - Sentence withheld 1 yr probation concurrent.  10 days jail, huber cost  & $200. surcharge.  Ct 5 Sentence 1 yrs probation.  30 days jail.  Cost & DNA $200 surcharge.  Jail sentences are all consecutive.  15CF144 Ct 1 - sentence 1 yr probation concurrent with previous.  30 days jail, consecutive.  Court cost, & DNA $200 surcharge  Credit 10 days if revoked.  Ct 2 - 1 yr probation, sentence withheld  30 days jail, consecutive.  Court cost & DNA surcharge $250.  Concurrent with ct 1.  15CM143 - Court cost & DNA surcharge and $300.00 restitution.   15CF88 Ct 1 - Sentence 1 yr probation, concurrent.  10 days jail,  huber.  Credit 6 days if revoked.  Court cost & DNA surcharge $200.  Jail term consecutive.  15CF162 Ct 1 - Sentence 1 year probation concurrent.  30 days jail, huber   Credit 9 days if revoked.  Court cost & DNA surcharge $250.  Ct3 1 yr probation 30 days jail,  huber cost & DNA 200.  14CM220 Ct 1 Sentence withheld 1 yr probation  30 days jail, huber  Court cost.  No DNA surcharge.  Ct 3 withheld sentence 1 yr probation  10 days jail,  huber.  Cost No DNA surcharge.  All sentences are withheld with probation.  Felony conviction rights reviewed.    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Post conviction rights   Court reviews bonds.  All bonds that were ordered forfeited shall be forfeited $1000., $5000., and $750.00  Bond of 1500 to be applied towards cost in that case, then to oldest case for cost.  15CF160 State request proof of restitution paid to CoVantage,  Per Atty Goetz def was charged in Marathon County.  14CM169 case was dismissed, holding $500.00, to be returned to poster.   State requesting restitution be paid first from $1500.00, cost from bond and then restitution.  15FO201 - outstanding fine $200.50 to be taken from bond.

Defendant Joshua David Micke in court with attorney Paul M Goetz.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @ 3:12 pm. State gives plea agreement, waiver of p.h. plea to ct's 1 & 2 DRI 345, PSI both side to free to argue.  Parties agree.  Waiver of P.H. Examination filed.  Def. understands & will waive. Court will accept waiver of p.h. & finds probable cause & finds probable cause.  Information Filed. Atty Goetz has copy of information, waives reading.  Def. understands charges & penalties.  Plea questionnaire & waiver of rights filed.  Def. agrees. Ct 1 Obstructing, no contest plea, ct 2 Bailjumping, no contest plea Ct's 3, 4 & 5 DRI.  Def. advised of constitutional rights & JT rights. Def. understands elements.  Atty Goetz is satisfied. Court finds pleas are freely & voluntarily given.  Stipulate to factual basis.  Court finds factual basis, accept pleas & finds def. Guilty to ct 1 Obstructing & ct 2 Bailjumping.  Court orders PSI & to be filed by 4-8-16.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Joshua David Micke in court via video with attorney Paul M Goetz.  Defendant Joshua David Micke in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called 15CF144 and 15CF160.  Bond forfeiture notices have been sent out to all parties, including bond posters.  Statement by Atty Goetz in regards to bond forfeitures.  Court will orders bonds forfeited in both cases.

Defendant Joshua David Micke in court with attorney Paul M Goetz.  Defendant Joshua David Micke in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called 15CF144,15CF160, 15CF162 and 15CF172 and new complaint.  Cases were called earlier.  Counsel has talked to client.  Def will waive time limits for preliminary hearings and will not demand speedy trials.  Bonds to be set for 15CF172 and new complaint.  State moves to forfeit bond in 15CF160 and request additional $5000.00 bond to cover both.  State moves to forfeit $1000.00 in 15CF144.  Court will reserve ruling on bond forfeitures.  Atty Goetz request $1000 cash bond.  Court sets bond on new case and 15CF172.  Court will forfeit bonds pending hearing  Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Joshua David Micke in court via video with attorney Paul M Goetz.  Defendant Joshua David Micke in custody.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Cases called 15CF160, 15CF162, 15CF172 and new complaint.  15CF144 also called.  Atty Goetz has copy of all complaints.  Waive reading of each complaints.  Counsel wishes to contact his client in regards to preliminary and speedy trial.  Court will allow counsel to contact def and will recall later

Attorney Wright C. Laufenberg in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CF144, 15CF80, 15CF88, 15CM143, 14CM169, 14CM220, 15CF160 and 15CF162 @ 10:15 a.m. Atty Laufenberg makes statement, asks to withdraw from all cases he is currently on due to conflict of interest. Has advised Def. in writing. Def was aware cases were going to be called today. Public Defender's office is appointing Atty Paul Goetz. Court grants motion to withdraw on all. Court will send notice to Atty Goetz to appear in person on 9/14/15.  Status conference scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
